channel.title: iOS on Memo Tut
channel.description: Recent content in iOS on Memo Tut

item.title: [Python] [IOS] First Pyto
item.description: #Introduction I think Pythonista is the most famous Python environment for iOS. Personally Pythonista It has not been updated for more than 2 years (as of 2020/2/24) (Added 2020/3/9: Pythonista v3.3 was released) There are few supported libraries (Pandas cannot be used) That was the reason why I was postponed from purchasing. One day, an application called “Pyto” was introduced in Nikkei Software, and when I searched it, the following points were attractive compared to Pythonista, so I purchased it.

item.title: [Python] Let Siri do the job of reading AWS bills posted by Slackbot
item.description: #Introduction I’ve been using the iPhone for less than a decade and I noticed that Siri wasn’t working at all. Now that smart speakers are popular, I want my Siri to do more, so I decided to read the AWS bill posted by Slackbot. From the results, it looks like this. When you ask for the price… He read the content I posted to Slack. Then, I will introduce various ways to make it.

item.title: [Python] IOS application development with Python (kivy) that can be done by monkeys
item.description: #Introduction Python, which is active in the field of machine learning and data science, has a simple GUI, and kivy used this time can make applications that can be run on desktop, Android, or iOS by building it. This time, I will give a simple explanation for those who have not made an application but know Python to some extent. Not even a memorandum to yourself. .. What is #kivy One of Python’s libraries that allows you to easily create a GUI (Graphical User Interface: not a black console screen).

item.title: [Python] Looking Back on iOS'Healthcare App' 2019
item.description: This article is the 9th day of the Docomo Advent Calendar. It is Yamamoto of DoCoMo. In my work, I am engaged in R&D related to healthcare. In this article, we will introduce how to utilize the data acquired by the iPhone Healthcare App. ■ Introduction □ Target person ・I am interested in healthcare using mobile wearable devices ・I would like to see the data of the iOS healthcare app ・Those who have reached this article

item.title: [Python] Send push notification to iOS app with Python 2 (with sample code)
item.description: ## Introduction Last time I wrote a similar article, I wrote it without experimenting and when I tried it, it didn’t work, so I’ll write the article again, including corrections! Send push notifications to iOS apps with Python Environment Python 2.7.11 pip 8.1.2 apns==2.0.1 Environmental configuration Install apns with pip after building a virtual environment with Virtualenv $ pip install apns Preparation Write out a pem file that sends push notifications from the keychain.
